page.title: 17Religion
page.content: Sanquhar is predominantly a Scottish Presbyterian Community, and 3 Kirks within the town's boundaries serve the needs of the parishioners. Families wishing to worship in an Episcopalian Church must travel 26 miles to Dumfries for weekly worship, although services are sometimes held in a small Episcopalian church 20 miles west of town. The nearest Roman Catholic chapel is 4 miles NW of town and 10 Sanquhar families regularly worship there. Regular services attended by 4 local families are held in a Christian Brethren meeting hall. A family which attends the Church of the Latter Day Saints travels to Dumfries for weekly worship. Sanquhar was the centre of much Covenanting activity during the late 17th. Century and outdoor conventicles are held occasionally to commemorate this time in our history .
